cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 153 (Friday, October 4, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NEWHOUSE:H.R. 9932.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 7The single subject of this legislation is:To prohibit the United States Postal Service from usingfunds to close small post offices or perform mail processingfacility reviews in election years, and for other purposes.[Page H5854]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

bill.title: Upholding USPS Delivery Standards and Election Integrity Act of 2024

item.title: Upholding USPS Delivery Standards and Election Integrity Act of 2024
Upholding USPS Delivery Standards and Election Integrity Act of 2024
To prohibit the United States Postal Service from using funds to close small post offices or perform mail processing facility reviews in election years, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Accountability.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
